Description: Rim sherd (mended from seven fragments, including 1886,0401.1080 and 1558) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with handle root; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (fired reddish) below; traces of two bands in added colour near top of sherd and part of lotus flower in added white outline and added red below; near bottom of sherd, traces of two white bands; exterior: dot and billet pattern and dotted squares flanked by two lines around rim; below, vertical strip of decoration above handle area: rectangles with maeanders, flanked by bands of hook maeander and dot and billet; to right, painted decoration consisting of hindquarters of goat, to the right; roundels, dots, pendant triangle and short strokes as filling ornament; below, part of handle root.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1886,0401.1080 and 1886,0401.1558. The metopal decoration consisting of vertical dividing bands and large maeander pattern is typical of the Wild Goat Style. The presence of interior decoration, however, suggests that the vessel is late in that style and may represent a transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 50, pl. V, no. 25)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 240, no. 210)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0398) (phase 2)
